image.altText: Silhouettes of five people are coloured and laid out in a graphic.

props.synopsis: After four-and-a-half years of horrific evidence, Australia's biggest-ever investigation into the treatment of people with disability has dropped its final report. Here are the main takeaways.

title.children: After years of 'harrowing' evidence, the disability royal commission wants these changes

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: An Adelaide cheerleading coach who had been accused of sexually assaulting girls at a club is acquitted of all charges, after a judge finds the complainants were "not credible or reliable".

title.children: Cheerleading coach acquitted of sexually assaulting girls

image.altText: An Adelaide United flag at Hindmarsh Stadium.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide stadium executive stood down after a decision to ban Melbourne Victory fans from the venue — a move that was subsequently overturned — has now been sacked.

title.children: Hindmarsh Stadium chief sacked following Victory fan ban bungle

image.altText: An unidentified pregnant woman.

props.synopsis: The review was commissioned by the South Australian government after the Whyalla Hospital was had to suspend its birthing service due to a lack of staff, forcing patients to travel to Adelaide or Port Augusta to give birth.

title.children: Midwives in regional SA town face lack of support, outdated facilities, report finds

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A magistrate said the then 15-year-old had not intended to cause harm when he shook or forcibly threw his baby, but had been reckless.

title.children: Teenage father avoids conviction in baby neglect case

image.altText: Injured victims of bomb explosion are treated at a hospital.

props.synopsis: A suicide bombing at a religious gathering in southwest Pakistan has killed at least 52 people and injured more than 50, local authorities say.

title.children: At least 52 killed and scores injured in Pakistan suicide bombing

image.altText: Nicole Lee

props.synopsis: After an inquiry lasting four and a half years, the royal commission makes 222 recommendations for change.

title.children: 'Pride, but also grief': Government to start taskforce following disability royal commission final report

image.altText: Two people on a boat with scientific equipment.

props.synopsis: The presence of microplastics in South Australia's waterways is largely due to fibres from synthetic clothing — and particles from tyres — entering rivers, creeks and the ocean, researchers say.

title.children: Clothes and tyres driving plastic presence in SA waterways

image.altText: A woman wearing a red dress holding a glass of beer poses for the camera

props.synopsis: Zoe Nolan remembers how quickly her close friend's health deteriorated while they were both battling eating disorders.

title.children: Zoe watched her friend die from an eating disorder. She says getting help is not so 'simple'

image.altText: kayaking river

props.synopsis: While some river towns are still recovering from the third highest flood ever recorded in South Australia, locals are ready to welcome back tourists with open arms.

title.children: One year on from SA's major floods, these Riverland communities are urging tourists to return

image.altText: A koala joey peers out from their mother's fur

props.synopsis: Tourists love them but koalas are not native to the island off South Australia, and there is concern the environment cannot support them.

title.children: Sterilisation, contraception considered for koala population damaging Kangaroo Island

image.altText: A green and beige camouflaged helicopter sits in shallow water at daybreak at a beach.

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force's MRH-90 Taipan helicopter fleet — one of which was involved in a fatal military training exercise in the Whitsundays — has been retired early.

title.children: Australian Defence Force MRH-90 Taipan helicopters involved in fatal crash retired early

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

props.synopsis: The notices mean Ms Milgate is now banned from entering any NT electoral offices, a breach of which could see her face further legal action.

title.children: Real estate agent Suzi Milgate issued with trespass notices over crepe attack on NT chief minister

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair speaks to male colleagues

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Elise Archer resigns from cabinet, following allegations she engaged in bullying and inappropriate behaviour, and says she will also resign from parliament.

title.children: Tasmanian Attorney-General Elise Archer quits amid bullying allegations

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Peter John van de Wetering smiling in front of a grey wall

props.synopsis: A man who lured a German backpacker to a remote farm with a fake job advert before drugging, restraining and raping her will remain behind bars.

title.children: 'Severe' risk posed by Peter van de Wetering mitigated with indefinite prison sentence

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge has ordered that the identity of a high-profile man charged with two counts of rape remain a secret for now.

title.children: Identity of high-profile man accused of rape in Toowoomba to remain secret

image.altText: Ellyse Perry wears her magenta and black Sixers kit as she heads a soccer ball

props.synopsis: As a 16-year-old dual international, Ellyse Perry had the choice between cricket and football. As time went on she eventually picked cricket, but after watching the incredible FIFA Women's World Cup, does she have any regrets?

title.children: 'I have no regrets': Ellyse Perry reflects on decision to pick cricket over football

image.altText: An Aboriginal flag in the foreground, Parliament House in the background

props.synopsis: The Lowitja Institute's chair has expressed alarm over "misleading" claims about Indigenous funding being circulated in the lead-up to the national Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Indigenous health institute dismayed by 'misleading' funding claims in Voice debate

image.altText: an alligator standing by a man's leg with a leash around its neck

props.synopsis: A fan is refused entry to a baseball game in Philadelphia after officials refuse to allow his emotional support animal — an alligator named WallyGator — into the ballpark.

title.children: Emotional support alligator denied entry to baseball stadium

image.altText: Pink and green visualisation of covid-19

props.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction for the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia

image.altText: Generic keys on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: Australia’s Federal Court has ordered the blocking of an updated set of domains for copyright infringement in a continuation of the battle over online piracy.

title.children: New list of blocked domains revealed in fight against 'rampant' copyright infringement

image.altText: Black and white image of Whetoi Pomare

props.synopsis: Aotearoa New Zealand has had a treaty in place for almost two centuries but it wasn't until the 1970s that it was truly honoured. So what happened and what are the lessons for Australia ahead of the Voice referendum?

title.children: New Zealand reneged on its Treaty with Māori. Here's its pre-referendum message to Indigenous Australians

image.altText: A man in a white polo shirt holds a bicycle part.

props.synopsis: At least 2.8 million cranksets globally are set to be the subject of an inspection and review program launched this week by Shimano, the largest manufacturer of bicycle components in the world.

title.children: World's largest bicycle component manufacturer issues global review of part after widespread reports of malfunction

image.altText: MG

props.synopsis: Before Harry Potter, the veteran actor made his mark in stage dramas, satirical comedies and crime films.

title.children: Michael Gambon achieved an incredible amount before he put his stamp on Harry Potter

image.altText: A phone screen showing the time 6.25 is in front of the analog flinders st station clock showing 6.20

props.synopsis: Recently found yourself five minutes late? Consider blaming it on a historic clock at Flinders Street Station.

title.children: Nobody had noticed when the ABC asked why the Flinders Street Station clock was running slow

image.altText: Andrews, Albanese and Palaszczuk sit at a long table with some papers talking, with others out of frame.

props.synopsis: Just two months ago, two of the strongest Labor leaders in recent history were solidly ensconced in WA and Victoria. They've now walked away.

title.children: Challenging times ahead for Labor and Albanese as another change of state leader looms on the horizon

image.altText: former prison officer wayne astill sits outdoors at a cafe table

props.synopsis: A special commission of inquiry is looking at what Corrective Services NSW staff, or prison management, knew about the offending of senior prison guard, Wayne Gregory Astill.

title.children: 'Power imbalance' stopped female inmates from reporting prison officer's sexual abuse, inquiry told

image.altText: Next to just visible blue pool water, a woman with sunglasses and stripy top lays with phone held over her face.

props.synopsis: If you're trying to change bad habits at work or home, this expert says ignore the traditional approaches to changing behaviour.

title.children: Here's how you create better habits — and it doesn't involve willpower or fad diets

props.synopsis: Here's your quick pocket guide on daylight saving as Australia comes into the warmer months.

title.children: When does daylight saving start? Here’s what time the clocks go forward and where

image.altText: A shot of crowds enjoying the 2023 AFL grand final parade in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: This year's grand final parade, which drew thousands of Brisbane Lions and Collingwood Magpies supporters into the precinct surrounding the MCG, returned to dry land after last year's event made its way down the Yarra on boats.

title.children: Thousands of supporters flock to Melbourne as AFL grand final parade returns to dry land

image.altText: A clean-shaven man wearing a blue polo shirt and cat smiles.

props.synopsis: European golfer Viktor Hovland got the Ryder Cup weekend off to a superb start with a rare hole in one — the problem was, it came a day early and wasn't even really a hole in one.

title.children: This golfer hit a hole in one in a par four at the Ryder Cup — here's why it didn't count

image.altText: People sunbathing by the beach

props.synopsis: The October long weekend is a welcome break for many Australians – but not everyone gets to enjoy it. Here's who gets a public holiday on Monday.

title.children: Monday is a public holiday, but only for some states and a territory

image.altText: An image of book covers overlaid with blue and two robotic hands and arms

props.synopsis: Tech giants have been accused of "mass copyright infringement" and "system theft" by authors whose work has been used to train generative AI systems such as ChatGPT.

title.children: 'Outright theft': Furious Australian authors caught up in literary AI scandal
